intro: Xiphopteris setosa, commonly known as the hairy cliff brake, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched fronds that are covered in fine, hairy structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained, sandy soils. Its spores are released from the sori, which are located on the underside of the fronds. Xiphopteris setosa is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
